::Triggerhappy/Skullgrin/Orchestra::

        Triggerhappy stood outside Co=
ndor's cell.  He was beginning to get very bored.  He looked at Condor.
   =

         "Hey buddy, I don't like this either, but apparently, I'md doing =
it for the good of my health.  So just do as your expected here," He warned=
.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
           Skullgrin arrived =
at the Decepticon base, tired from constantly switching back and forth from=
 walking to driving in tank mode to walking and tank mode.  He went into th=
e Decepticon base.  Hopefully, he wouldn't be found as an enemy to anybody =
here.  He roamed the base, when he saw Triggerhappy.

          "Hey!  You!=
!  Triggerhappy!!  Nice to see you!  Haven't seen you for several hundred y=
ears!" He greeted.

            Triggerhappy laughed for a few seconds, the=
n looked at Condor, then at Skullgrin.

            "What're you doing righ=
t now?" He asked.

            Skullgrin looked at Condor in the cell, then=
 got a grin.

            "Well, how would you like it if I said I was reli=
eving you of guard duty?" He asked.

             Triggerhappy grinned a gr=
in of relief.

             "Would you?  Thanks, now I can do other stuff!"=
 He said, walking away.

             Skullgrin went up to the cell, and sa=
t down, but had his gun ready to fire at this Maximal.

              "You =
Maximals could really turn out to be pests.  Listen, so-called Autobot desc=
endant, when you're around me, you better fear me.  It is a sign of respect=
, but more importantly, it is perfectly logical.  I am one of the most evil=
 Decepticons you'll ever meet, so you better sleep with one eye open!  That=
 is, if you live long enough to get some sleep," He said, in a truely evil =
tone.
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
         Orchestra nodded=
 slowly.

         "Hmm, if we can disable this enemy's shields, I can snea=
k into their base and hopefully retrieve valuable propaganda," He said,"Sou=
nd like a plan?"
